programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Houston (1-3) comes off a 23-16 loss to Birmingham after secured its first win of the season in an 18-17 victory over Memphis; San Antonio (1-3), the defending XFL Conference champion, ended its three-game skid with a 24-18 win over DC.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (3-1) had its undefeated start ended by San Antonio, 24-18, despite 373 total yards and three TDs from Jordan Ta'amu; Arlington (3-1) rebounded with a 30-15 win over St. Louis behind 149 passing yards and a touchdown from Luis Perez.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: A preview of the upcoming Major League Baseball game with expert analysis, insightful observations and exclusive interviews; coverage includes highlights of Major League Baseball games and the latest baseball news with knowledgeable commentary.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Defending champion Florida and Tampa Bay split four meetings during the regular season, but the Panthers eliminated the Lightning in the first round of the 2024 playoffs, 4-1, behind Carter Verhaeghe and Matthew Tkachuk, who both had nine points.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Minnesota gained a 2-1 series lead with a 116-104 win in Game 3 behind 30 points from Jaden McDaniels, along with 29 points and eight assists from Anthony Edwards; LeBron James led the Lakers with 38 points and 10 rebounds in the loss.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Colorado won two of its three season meetings with Dallas, but the Stars won the lone home matchup, 5-3, back on Nov. 29 behind two goals from Mason Marchment and eliminated the Avalanche in the 2024 Western Conference Semifinals, 4-2.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The worldwide leader in sports covers all the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.desc: The worldwide leader in sports covers all the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 3-ranked Texas comes into the series ranked fourth in the nation with a .361 team batting average and eighth in the country with a 2.12 team ERA; Kassidi Pickering and Nelly McEnroe-Marinas lead No. 4-ranked Oklahoma in HRs and RBIs.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night
programme.desc: Ian Machado Garry (15-1) goes up against Carlos Prates (21-6) in the welterweight main event; Anthony Smith (38-21) faces Zhang Mingyang (18-6) in a light heavyweight bout; Giga Chikadze (15-4) vs. David Onama (13-2) in a featherweight bout.

programme.title: SEC Storied: Book of Manning
programme.desc: A father-and-son story written into the pages of football folklore, it can be argued that no family has had more influence on a sport than the Mannings.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Texas A&M is allowing a .247 batting average to opponents this season; Rylan Galvan, who comes into the series against the Aggies with a .342 batting average, leads top-ranked Texas in home runs, walks, on-base and slugging percentage in 2025.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 19-ranked Clemson ranks third in the conference in hits, home runs and RBIs entering the weekend series against the Yellowjackets; Georgia Tech seeks its most wins over a ranked opponent in a season since earning six victories in 2012.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Joining the list of memorable defense lines with even more memorable nicknames in NFL history, Mark Gastineau, Joe Klecko, Marty Lyons and Abdul Salaam formed one of the most dominant defensive lines in NFL history for the New York Jets in the 1980s.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The '85 Chicago Bears decimated their NFL counterparts en route to a 15-1 record and a victory in Super Bowl XX, as they featured a number of strong personalities such as Mike Ditka and Jim McMahon and a slew of talented players like Mike Singletary.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: Cameras follow the newest members of the NFL as they go through the draft, preseason, training camp, numerous hazing rituals instigated by veteran players, and an assortment of other situations that will test each rookie's mettle.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: Cameras follow the newest members of the NFL as they go through the draft, preseason, training camp, numerous hazing rituals instigated by veteran players, and an assortment of other situations that will test each rookie's mettle.

programme.desc: Cameras follow the newest members of the NFL as they go through the draft, preseason, training camp, numerous hazing rituals instigated by veteran players, and an assortment of other situations that will test each rookie's mettle.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: From 1990-1993, the Buffalo Bills were known as much for their talent as their fighting in the locker room, but the team managed to come together to make a series of memorable Super Bowl runs that all ended in disappointment.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: John Elway, Todd Blackledge, Jim Kelly, Tony Eason, Ken O'Brien and Dan Marino were the six quarterbacks selected in the first round of the 1983 NFL Draft, and three of those players went on to craft Hall of Fame careers in the NFL.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: New York gained a 2-1 series lead with a 118-116 win over Detroit in Game 3 behind 31 points and eight rebounds from Karl-Anthony Towns, along with 30 points from Jalen Brunson; Cade Cunningham led the Pistons with 24 points and 11 assists.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Aaron Nola (0-5, 6.43) lost his first five starts of the season, but is 7-2 with a 4.52 ERA in 10 starts against the Cubs; Jameson Taillon (1-1, 4.73) held Arizona to one run on three hits in five innings in a no-decision on April 20.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Analysts and draft insiders give grades to each team for their picks in the 2024 NFL Draft, going over which teams used their selections the best in adding players to fill in needs on their rosters and which teams still have work to do.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: One More Round: Inoue vs. Nery
programme.desc: Naoya Inoue stepped into the ring for what was to be a crowning moment in his career, but his junior featherweight title defense against Luis Nery would bring with it something that never happened, an Inoue knockdown and the challenge to bounce back.

programme.title: My Wish
programme.desc: Some of the biggest sports superstars in the United States help fulfill the holiday wishes of sick children by meeting them and spending time with the kids, sharing the holiday spirit with everyone and giving a kid a Christmas to remember.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in the sixth event of the season for a $25 million purse; Marc Leishman won the individual title with a one-stroke victory over Charl Schwartzel, while Ripper GC won the team crown in fifth event in Miami on April 8.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Jesus Luzardo (2-0, 2.08) allowed three or fewer runs in his first five starts but has earned no-decisions in his last three outings; Ben Brown (2-1, 4.57) held Arizona to one run on three hits in four innings of work in a no-decision on April 19.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: RaceDay previews the Jack Link's 500 and Kyle Larson, who comes off his second win in the last four races with a victory at Bristol, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: Major League Pickleball
programme.desc: Started in 2021, Major League Pickleball brings a unique team aspect to the growing tennis-like sport, featuring the top players from around the world competing on 24 different teams as they play in events across the United States.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in Top Fuel, Pro Stock and Funny Car; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various categories.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Tyler Mahle (3-0, 0.68) has thrown 16-straight scoreless innings after shutting out the Dodgers in seven innings on April 20; Robbie Ray (3-0, 4.07) has earned no decisions in his last two starts after winning his first three of the seasons.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: Two weeks prior to event, good water clarity and lake level less than half a foot over the full pool level of 660 feet was reported, with midmorning water temperatures reading around 65 degrees, all of which point to a spawn/postspawn tournament.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Atlanta claimed victories against Grand Rapids in two of their first three meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on March 13 with a 3-1 scoreline; Merritt Beason recorded 13 kills, 13 digs and 4 blocks for the Vibe in the win.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Major League Pickleball
programme.desc: Started in 2021, Major League Pickleball brings a unique team aspect to the growing tennis-like sport, featuring the top players from around the world competing on 24 different teams as they play in events across the United States.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his second win in the last four races with his dominant victory at Bristol over Denny Hamlin, who had his two-race winning streak snapped; Tyler Reddick and Ricky Stenhouse Jr. won the two races at Talladega last year.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez moved back into first place and gained a 17-point lead over his brother, Alex, after winning at Qatar for his third win of 2025; Jorge Martin won the sprint race at Spain last year over Pedro Acosta.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Two-time champion Francesco Bagnaia secured his first win of the season with his victory at COTA, while Alex Marquez passed his brother, Marc, in the standings by one point; Bagnaia won the race at Qatar last year over Brad Binder.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez moved back into first place and gained a 17-point lead over his brother, Alex, after winning at Qatar for his third win of 2025; Francesco Bagnaia won the grand prix race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his second win in the last four races with his dominant victory at Bristol over Denny Hamlin, who had his two-race winning streak snapped; Tyler Reddick and Ricky Stenhouse Jr. won the two races at Talladega last year.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Memphis (0-4) is still in search of its first win this season, averaging 12.5 ppg in its first four games; Birmingham (3-1), the defending champions, won three-straight games since opening the season with an 18-11 loss to DC on March 30.

programme.title: Culture of Winning: Polynesian Football Pride
programme.desc: A look at the success of Polynesian NFL players and the impact their sports success has back on their communities; Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa will be joined by Penei Sewell, Puka Nacua, Jonah Savaiinaea and Chris Henry Jr.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Brenden Queen extended his lead over Lavar Scott to 11 points after finishing second at Phoenix, while Brent Crews secured his third Menards Series win of his career; Jake Finch won the race at Talladega last year over Kris Wright.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Atlanta claimed victories against Grand Rapids in two of their first three meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on March 13 with a 3-1 scoreline; Merritt Beason recorded 13 kills, 13 digs and 4 blocks for the Vibe in the win.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez moved back into first place and gained a 17-point lead over his brother, Alex, after winning at Qatar for his third win of 2025; Jorge Martin won the sprint race at Spain last year over Pedro Acosta.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in fifth event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Dean Burmester won the individual crown with a playoff triumph over Sergio Garcia, while Legion XIII took home the team title with a one-shot victory in last year's edition.

programme.title: Copa America 2024: Argentina's Road to Glory
PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Teams composed of players represented by bowling ball parent sponsors Brunswick (four teams), Storm (three teams) and independent brand MOTIV (one team) compete in the final event of the season with the winning team earning a $100,000 top prize.

programme.title: Driven By Speed: Keanu Reeves vs Cody Jones
programme.desc: Action movie star Keanu Reeves and Cody Jones from Dude Perfect take to the legendary Indianapolis Motor Speedway for a head-to-head race, as all-access footage shows the training and preparation between car and driver leading up to the event.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: Mexican Liga MX Soccer
programme.desc: Pumas had claimed victories in two straight meetings with Juárez before they played to a scoreless draw in their most recent matchup on April 12; Pumas recorded 9 total shots, to Juárez's 4, while keeping 55 percent of possession.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Geelong (4-2-0) has won its last three contests after defeating Hawthorn, 86-79, on April 21; Carlton (2-4-0) split two meetings with the Cats last season, including a 138-75 victory at MCG in Round 15, as Tom De Koning had 25 disposals and a goal.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in the sixth event of the season for a $25 million purse; Marc Leishman won the individual title with a one-stroke victory over Charl Schwartzel, while Ripper GC won the team crown in fifth event in Miami on April 8.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: Two weeks prior to event, good water clarity and lake level less than half a foot over the full pool level of 660 feet was reported, with midmorning water temperatures reading around 65 degrees, all of which point to a spawn/postspawn tournament.

programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez moved back into first place and gained a 17-point lead over his brother, Alex, after winning at Qatar for his third win of 2025; Francesco Bagnaia won the grand prix race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: NHRA Pro Mod Series
programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Orlando City claimed a 1-0 victory against Atlanta United in the Eastern conference semi-finals round on Nov. 24 with a winner scored by Ramiro Enrique; Orlando recorded 14 total shots, to Atlanta's 8, while keeping 49 percent of possession.
